title: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast elected Chile’s next president | Chile | The Guardian
snippet: Sun 14 Dec 2025 18.40 ESTLast modified on Tue 16 Dec 2025 00.08 EST · Share · The ultra-conservative former congressman José Antonio Kast has been elected as Chile’s next president.

title: 2025 Chilean general election - Wikipedia
snippet: General elections were held in Chile on 16 November 2025. Voters went to the polls to elect the 38th President of Chile, renew all 155 seats in the Chamber of Deputies, and fill 23 of the 50 seats in the Senate.

title: President of Chile - Wikipedia
snippet: José Antonio Kast will take office on 11 March 2026, having won the 2025 Chilean general election. The origins of Chile as a nation can be traced to 1541, when it was separated from the existing Viceroyalty of Peru by King Charles I, creating the new Kingdom of Chile.

title: Kast’s Victory in Chile Is Another Win for Global Right-Wing Movement - The New York Times
snippet: José Antonio Kast, who was elected president on Sunday, is the latest conservative to rise to power promising strict law and order measures.

title: Chile elects Kast as president in sharp rightward shift | Reuters
snippet: [1/3]Jose Antonio Kast, presidential candidate of the far-right Republican Party of Chile and his wife Maria Pia Adriasola wave to their supporters as they celebrate after Kast won Chile's presidency in a presidential runoff election, in Santiago, ...
